poem:
**The Empty Stage**

In the quiet, a lament—  
sequins fall to silence  
where laughter once moved.  
Unpainted nights  
clutch the pearls of memory,  
and the mirror holds  
only echoes now.  
A shattered heart mourns  
the colors of a life—  
unrevealed, yet brilliant,  
lost to the hush  
and the closing curtain.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ex-husband of The Vivienne says ‘heart is shattered’ after Drag Race star’s death The ex-husband of the drag artist known as The Vivienne has said his “heart is shattered” after the death of the RuPaul’s Drag Race star, as the hit TV show’s host paid tribute to “a lovely human being”. James Lee Williams, who won the 2019 first series of RuPaul’s Drag Race UK as The Vivienne, died at the weekend aged 32. In". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
